question.questionText: Look at the rubbings of 2 different fabrics. What do the rubbings tell us about the different textures of these 2 fabrics?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Fabric A is smoother and has a finer texture. Fabric B is rougher and has a coarser texture.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: They are different. Like bark not bark.
They do not have the same rubbing material to be the same.
That one has holes and the other one does not. One probably smooth and the other one bumpy.
They are not the same letter B has big spots and letter A has lines and little spots.
Rubbing A is not that clear because they rubbed it soft and B is rubbed hard.
A. Might be soft B. might be a little bumpy.
B is bumpy A is smooth.
A tells you it has dashing lines B is telling us it has bumps.
Fabric B has lots of clear, round bumps. Fabric A has smaller, blurry bumps.
They are bumpy.
If you look you can tell that B is sort of like a metal gate and A is sort of like a wall.
It is different because rubbing B has holes that are dark shaded wide and rubbing A has small holes that are mostly rough.

Rubbing A was smooth, and rubbing B was rough and bumpy.
